rev.comment: why the wording "would"? can't the device do this? If not then please revert!

Line 81: Line 81:
The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1280x720-pixel [[Super AMOLED|HD Super AMOLED]] [[PenTile]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-has-curved-pentile-oled-display-21189996 |title=Galaxy Nexus has curved PenTile OLED display |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> curved glass display,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|TI OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540,<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref> 1 GB of RAM, a 1,750 [[Ampere-hour|mAh]] battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-camera-and-1080p-video-samples/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus camera and 1080p video samples - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]] <ref name="brighthand18084"/> and it has 16 or 32 GB of internal memory.<ref>[http://www.shugalmela.com/samsung-galaxy-nexus-reviews-and-specification/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus internal memory]</ref>
The Galaxy Nexus features a 4.65-inch 1280x720-pixel [[Super AMOLED|HD Super AMOLED]] [[PenTile]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/galaxy-nexus-has-curved-pentile-oled-display-21189996 |title=Galaxy Nexus has curved PenTile OLED display |publisher=SlashGear |date= |accessdate=2011-10-27}}</ref> curved glass display,<ref name="engadget20111006"/> a dual-core 1.2 GHz [[Texas Instruments OMAP|TI OMAP]] 4460 processor (ARM Cortex-A9)<ref name="bgr20111006"/> with an accompanying [[PowerVR]] SGX540,<ref>[http://focus.ti.com/general/docs/wtbu/wtbuproductcontent.tsp?contentId=53243&navigationId=12843&templateId=6123 OMAPâ¢ 4 Platform: OMAP4430/OMAP4460]</ref> 1 GB of RAM, a 1,750 [[Ampere-hour|mAh]] battery, 1.3 MP front camera and 5 MP rear camera capable of [[1080p]] video,<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/samsung-galaxy-nexus-camera-and-1080p-video-samples/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus camera and 1080p video samples - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[4G]], [[Wi-Fi]] a/b/g/n, [[Bluetooth]], [[Global Positioning System|GPS]], [[Barometer]], and [[Near field communication|NFC]] <ref name="brighthand18084"/> and it has 16 or 32 GB of internal memory.<ref>[http://www.shugalmela.com/samsung-galaxy-nexus-reviews-and-specification/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus internal memory]</ref>
â
The Galaxy Nexus also hosts support for [[Mobile High-definition Link|MHL]] through the use of its [[Micro USB]] [[USB 2.0|2.0]] port.<ref name="mhl endgadget">{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/20/behind-the-glass-a-detailed-tour-inside-the-samsung-galaxy-nexu/ |title=Behind the glass: a detailed tour inside the Samsung Galaxy Nexus -- Engadget |first=Brad |last=Molen |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=24 October 2011 |work=Engadget}}</ref> This means that the device would be able to provide up to [[1080p]] [[audio-visual]] output (through [[HDMI]]) to any supported larger display such as [[High-definition television|HD Televison]].
+
The Galaxy Nexus also hosts support for [[Mobile High-definition Link|MHL]] through the use of its [[Micro USB]] [[USB 2.0|2.0]] port.<ref name="mhl endgadget">{{cite web |url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/20/behind-the-glass-a-detailed-tour-inside-the-samsung-galaxy-nexu/ |title=Behind the glass: a detailed tour inside the Samsung Galaxy Nexus -- Engadget |first=Brad |last=Molen |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=24 October 2011 |work=Engadget}}</ref> This means that the device is able to provide up to [[1080p]] [[audio-visual]] output (through [[HDMI]]) to any supported larger display such as [[High-definition television|HD Televison]].
The Galaxy Nexus has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software (part of Android 4.0). The 3.5 mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the center of the rear side. The phone will have 16/32 GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
The Galaxy Nexus has no physical buttons on the front, and instead features on-screen [[soft keys]] embedded into the system software (part of Android 4.0). The 3.5 mm headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone, and the camera is located in the center of the rear side. The phone will have 16/32 GB internal storage depending on model.<ref>18 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on], Engadget</ref>
